com.yantra.yfc.rcp

Class YRCBehavior

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCBaseBehavior
      • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCBehavior
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IYRCApiCallbackhandler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    YRCAlertAddCommentsBehavior, YRCAlertExceptionDetailsBehavior, YRCAlertGetNewPriorityPanelBehavior, YRCAlertMessageBehavior, YRCAssignAlertToQueueBehavior, YRCAssignAlertToUserBehavior, YRCCallCenterCustomerMessageBehavior, YRCCallCenterHeaderBehavior, YRCContainerRelatedTasksBehavior, YRCFilterPanelBehavior, YRCFindQueueBehavior, YRCFindUserBehavior, YRCStoreCustomerMessageBehavior, YRCStoreFooterBehavior, YRCStoreHeaderBehavior, YRCStoreInstructionWindowImplBehavior, YRCStoreMenuPanelBehavior, YRCStoreRelatedTasksBehavior, YRCSupplierSearchandListBehavior, YRCWizardBehavior, YRCWizardPageBehavior

    public class YRCBehavior
extends YRCBaseBehavior
    The class providing base implementation behavior controlling the behavior of the screens. The screens using xml bindings and other advanced features should create/initialize and use an instance of this class.
    Author:
    statikonda
    See Also:
    YRCBaseBehavior

    • Constructor Detail

      • YRCBehavior

        protected YRCBehavior(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite ownerComposite)
        Constructs an instance of the behavior for a wizard page. The constructor should be used to create the behavior for a wizard page only.
        Parameters:
        ownerComposite - The wizard page (an instance of Composite) being initialized.
        See Also:
        YRCWizardPageBehavior

      • YRCBehavior

        public YRCBehavior(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite ownerComposite,
                   java.lang.String formId)
        Constructs an instance of behavior of the form being initialized. The form has its own behavior which controls bindings of all the controls, and setting and retrieving of the xml models associated with the controls.
        Parameters:
        ownerComposite - The composite corresponding to the form being initialized.
        formId - The unique identifier of the form being initialized.

      • YRCBehavior

        public YRCBehavior(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent,
                   java.lang.String formId,
                   java.lang.Object inputObject)
        Constructs an instance of behavior of the form being initialized. The form has its own behavior which controls bindings of all the controls, and setting and retrieving of the xml models associated with the controls.
        Parameters:
        parent - The composite corresponding to the form being initialized.
        formId - The unique identifier of the form being initialized.
        inputObject - The input object of the screen. It can be accessed at any point of time.
        See Also:
        getInputObject()

    • Method Detail

      • init

        protected void init()
        The method is called while the behavior is being initialized. The method should be overridden and perform initializations. By default nothing is done.

      • getFieldValue

        public java.lang.String getFieldValue(java.lang.String fieldName)
        Specified by:
        getFieldValue in class YRCBaseBehavior
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the control for which the value needs to be fetched.
        Returns:
        Returns the string value of the control. In case of combo and list boxes, it will be the value corresponding to the code value. If the code value is null, the description value is returned.
        See Also:
        YRCBaseBehavior.getFieldValue(String)

      • setFieldValue

        public void setFieldValue(java.lang.String fieldName,
                          java.lang.Object obj)
        Description copied from class: YRCBaseBehavior
        Sets the value of the control on the screen. The set value, if applicable, will be displayed on the screen.
        Specified by:
        setFieldValue in class YRCBaseBehavior
        obj - The value that needs to be set on the control. For most of the controls it is a text value. Only in case of radio/check box ,if 'obj' is an instance of Boolean then selection is set according to the boolean value of 'obj'.Otherwise, 'obj' is used to set display text.
        See Also:
        YRCBaseBehavior.setFieldValue(String, Object)

      • setModel

        protected void setModel(org.w3c.dom.Element inputElem)
        By default, node name of the root element is used as the namespace for the model to be set.
        Parameters:
        inputElem - The input model that needs to be set for the form.
        See Also:
        setModel(String, Element)

      • setModel

        protected void setModel(java.lang.String namespace,
                        org.w3c.dom.Element inputElem)
        The model for the namespace name is updated and set if not done already. All controls that are bound with the input model are updated with the values passed in the model.
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace name of the input model.
        inputElem - The input model that needs to be set for the form.

      • setModel

        protected void setModel(java.lang.String namespace,
                        org.w3c.dom.Element inputElem,
                        boolean layout)
        The model for the namespace name is updated and set if not done already. All controls that are bound with the input model are updated with the values passed in the model.
        Parameters:
        namespace - The namespace name of the input model.
        inputElem - The input model that needs to be set for the form.
        layout - false if the layout of the owner composite doesn't need to be changed and true otherwise.

        Description copied from class: YRCBaseBehavior

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • setInputObject

        public void setInputObject(java.lang.Object inputObject)
        Sets the input object associated with the form. A place-holder for an object which is available across a form. e.g across a wizard, from all the pages.
        Parameters:
        inputObject - The input object to the form.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • addAndBindNewControl

        public void addAndBindNewControl(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite control)
        Utility method to initialize a new Composite, created dynamically. Initializing does the following: Binding, Localization, Theme In short every thing which happens when the behavior is initialized.
        Parameters:
        control - New composite created dynamically.

      • applyTheme

        public void applyTheme(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control control,
                       java.lang.String themeName)
        Utility method to change the font and theme of a control. Apply Theme does the following: Sets Background, Foreground colors and Font. NOTE: Theme is applied to the control passed, Controls children are left as is.
        Parameters:
        control - Control to theme.
        themeName - Theme to be applied.

      • addTableRows

        public final void addTableRows(java.lang.String tableName,
                               int numberOfRows)
        Utility method to add rows to a table dynamically. By default, the new row will be empty. To populate the table row with a default value override the method: populateDefaultTableItemAttributes(String, Element)
        Note: The table rows cannot be added in table with piped source bindings.
        Overrides:
        addTableRows in class YRCBaseBehavior
        Parameters:
        tableName - The control name of the table for which the operation needs to be performed.
        numberOfRows - Number of rows that needs to be added.
        See Also:
        populateDefaultTableItemAttributes(String, Element), YRCTableBindingData.setSourceBinding(String)

      • populateDefaultTableItemAttributes

        public void populateDefaultTableItemAttributes(java.lang.String tableName,
                                               org.w3c.dom.Element element)
        Utility method to populate the newly added row with some default values. By default, the method does nothing. The newly created rows will be empty. Child classes should override this method if the new rows should be populated with some default value.
        Overrides:
        populateDefaultTableItemAttributes in class YRCBaseBehavior
        Parameters:
        tableName - The control name of the table to which the row needs to be added.
        element - The element associated with the new table row.

      • showError

        public final void showError()
        Description copied from class: YRCBaseBehavior
        Message dialog showing the errors in the screen. This will show only one control in error at a time and the focus will go to the control in error. For table if full row selection is provided then the row in error will be highlighted .
        Specified by:
        showError in class YRCBaseBehavior
        See Also:
        YRCBaseBehavior.showError()

      • hasError

        public final boolean hasError()
        Description copied from class: YRCBaseBehavior
        This function return true if some control on the selected page is in error
        Specified by:
        hasError in class YRCBaseBehavior
        Returns:
        The boolean value if the screen is in error.
        See Also:
        YRCBaseBehavior.hasError()

      • getModelsMap

        public java.util.Map getModelsMap()
